alert.note: Alert for San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 3:22AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Utah, including the following county, south central San Juan. * WHEN...Until 515 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 AM MDT, Satellite estimates indicate heavy rain from thunderstorms in the advisory area. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Areas from Monument Valley to Mexican Hat to near Fry Caonyon are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mexican Hat, Halchita, Goulding and Tselakai Dezza.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
